Text:
It is a winter night. Beta is with her master,
delivering her regular report.

Normally, her report only contains information about
the Shadow Garden.

After all, Mitsugoshi's work is only peripheral to
this organization as a whole. There's usually no
need for her to waste his time with trivialities.

The rumors of counterfeit money are spreading
throughout the capital.
Hmm...
Achoo!

It's only a matter of time before the royal palace
takes serious action.

Setting up random checkpoints was a bad idea. The
negative impact on the market is immeasurable. It's
already...!
What's the matter?
Ah, no, um... You're taking notes, my lord...

What you're saying will have repercussions down the
line.
So, the situation is that grave.
Her master is taking this seriously.

The incident with Delta cast a heavy pall over all of
the Shadow Garden.

However, if their master's going to get serious—
Beta's sure they'll be able to overcome anything
that stands in their way.
Warmth floods her heart.
My apologies. I'll continue.
Keep it brief.

The situation is leading to inflation, and it's
becoming a concern for the kingdom that
cannot be ignored—
I...don't quite follow.
(Did he just say he didn't follow...?)

(He obviously didn't mean it literally. Master Shadow
understands everything, after all.)
(That means he must be suggesting something else—)
Is there an error in my report?!

He's asking how it's possible that she made such a
boneheaded mistake. He noticed her failure in an
instant.
I'll go back over my analysis immediately—
No, time is of the essence.
Let's continue.
My sincerest apologies...
Um, there is one other thing.
Something important thing...to report...
To deal with John Smith, we...dispatched Delta.

As a result, we've lost contact with her... We fear
she might be...dead!
Huh?
Huh?
No, never mind... Wait, hold on...
Delta's...yeah, she's...
She just went off on a long journey, that's all...
*gasp*
Tears stream down Beta's cheeks.
You're right...
I see now. Delta's just off on a long journey...
She's thankful for her master's awkward kindness.

...We consider John Smith to be a formidable foe.
If it's at all possible, Master Shadow...
Sorry, but I have business to attend to.
No, of course. Forgive me for my impertinence.
Um, excuse me...

Beta stops her master as he is about to leave.
There's something she wants to confirm first.
Hm?

Well...about that notepad, we actually have a rule
about immediately destroying or encrypting sensitive
documents, so...
Heh...
Have a look.
What a...complex encryption!
Y‑You came up with this all by yourself?!

I encoded it in a cipher I made up of the five
different languages—Japanese hiragana script,
katakana script, characters, Arabic numerals,
and Romanized Japanese.
P-Please teach me!
Let's see...

With that, Shadow quickly writes something on the
pad, then tears out the page and passes it to Beta.

When you can make out the meaning there, I'll explain
it to you.
I'll give you a glimpse of my wisdom... Achoo!
Thank you so much!

Beta makes a mental note to head to the lab at once
to get it analyzed.

John Smith is on the lookout aboard the freight
train.

Moving from the city to the suburbs, they are just
about to leave the capital...
Mr. Smith.
We're approaching the MCA's checkpoint.
...Keep going.

Garter has hired a private army to set up checkpoints
within the capital and inspect all goods coming in
and out.

Of course, they don't have permission to do so, and
their actions have no legal basis behind them.

However, most merchants wouldn't dare cross the
MCA, so they have no choice but to comply with the
investigation.
Are we really gonna do this?!

We were ordered to cause an "accident" if they didn't
stop!

But if we do that, the Knight Order won't keep
quiet...

What choice do we have?! If we defy 'em, we're done
for in the underworld!

No matter how big of a fella he is, Garter's still
just a merchant at the end of the day!

It's not Garter I'm worried about! It's who that
bastard works for—
Huh?!

The next moment, numerous wires whisk past the
mercenaries.

The wires wrap around the obstacles on the tracks,
slicing them apart.
The train continues on unhindered.
...Hey, mate.

Time to lay low. With luck, we'll come outta this
alive.
So long as those monsters don't find us...

The train continues without stopping at the MCA
checkpoint.

Just beyond it, the glow from the train's headlights
illuminates a figure standing directly in its path.
Hm?
Hello, John Smith.
And—good-bye.
